dialogue: A torrent of blood has been spilled in your wake. All for the sake of your beckoner.
All for this moment. Know that I have never lied to you. You are the jewel of my ambition. The Panacea to this rot our predecessors left behind. Listen carefully, my remnant.
The Daimaou didn't vanish. I killed him. With his power split into the orbs, the act itself was elementary.
He was in a weakened state, and with the assisstance of the Ashura-O, Gilles, Micah and yes, even the old man.
I sang them all a different lie, of course. One of their ideal worlds as you can imagine. And so we commited the greatest sin this kingdom has known. We killed a god.
The mysteries of the Daimaou are uncountable, and even as his body was laid to waste, he drew power from his Kings to begin reincarnation immediately.
I had to do two things at once; stagnate his resurrection and reclaim his orbs. So, therefore I wrenched 'you' from his 'dantian'.
You are the end result of absurdly complex magics. So long as you exist, the Daimaou's resurrection cannot truly be complete.
Not to be boastful, but I still believe it a stroke of genius on my part.
I am a remnant of the Daimaou?
No. You are your own person. A part of him merely resides within you. He has no claim to your body or soul.
Listen to me, my champion. With these Orbs we can remake this world. We can put an end to this absurb imbalance of power.
No more demons, no more humans, no more hatred, no more violence. Most importantly, no more Daimaou.
You wish to make everyone a demonoid?
It seems high-handed, you think? Changing people's bodies and souls without their consent. I understand.
But no matter how prudently one rules, a world with such disparity can never know peace.
Once Seithric power has been normalized, we can focus on uprooting the claws of tyranny that have dug into this world.

All the laws and guidelines I've read about. A society neither built on predation nor subjugation. But such a world cannot exist if a disparity between 'demon' and 'human' is allowed to continue to exist.
So please, dear Remnant. Place the Orbs in the Cauldron of Ascension, and hold in your heart your truest vision. Let us make this world anew.
